alert.note: Alert for Inland Broward County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 20 at 3:54PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Broward County through 430 PM EDT... At 354 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a funnel cloud 8 miles southwest of Intersection Alligator Alley And Miami Canal, or 23 miles west of Pembroke Pines, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Intersection Alligator Alley And Miami Canal, Mile Marker 30 On Alligator Alley and West Broward Rec. Area On Alligator Alley. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
